result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina Marie Liptow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Burnett County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $75 per month.
3) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tina Marie Liptow

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion

2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina Marie Liptow in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Tina Marie Liptow. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to amended Ct 1 Possession of amphetamine (misdemeanor), DRI the others; joint rec for 1 yr probation with a withheld sentence; may discharge early at DOC discretion.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Possession of Amphetamine; Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 and orders a JOC; Counts 2 and 3 are DRI.  Court questions defendant.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make another statement to the Court. 
Court orders:
$443 court costs, bond to be applied, remainder to be paid at a rate of $75 per month.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina Marie Liptow in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Tina Marie Liptow. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: agreement is close; meth diversion not an option.  State recaps his notes- meth diversion or plea to misdemeanor amphetamine.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina Marie Liptow not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Tina Marie Liptow. Def fails to appear for a status conference.  Atty Pollak makes record of status of case.  State requests warrant.  Court orders warrant, $100 cash bond.

10:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina Marie Liptow in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Tina Marie Liptow. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requesting additional status, offer has been presented.
Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:31 AM Defendant, Tina Marie Liptow, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Arraignment on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:20 PM Called 22CF23 for PH.  Defendant, Tina Marie Liptow, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appear in person.  Case is on for preliminary hearing. State calls first witness, Deputy Mikal Anton, who is sworn in by the court and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant, identification is made.  Venue is made.  Attny Pollak questions Deputy Anton.  State objects, Court notes already answered, answer stands.  No further questions. No redirect.  Witness steps down.  No other witnesses.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State efiles information, it mirrors the criminal complaint. Bond continues. Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:34 PM Recalling 22CF23 and 21TR943. Defendant, Tina Marie Liptow, appeared in person.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin in person.  Warrant quashed.  Def appears without counsel today.  Def had been sitting in the wrong room but in the building since 2pm.  Def updated the court that she is now unemployed, intents to re-apply for an Attny through PD office. Court will reschedule PH for another date, bond continues.  State in agreement.  In regards to the TR case, Def has DL now, shows proof to the State.  State would move to dismiss 21TR943, OAS ticket.  Motion granted, dismissed without cost and with prejudice.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:22 PM Called 22CF23 scheduled for PH and 21TR943 for STC.  Defendant Tina Marie Liptow not in court. ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Other courtroom and hallway have been checked, no def.  State asks for WA body only, WI and adjacent states, so ordered by the court. Adjourned.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - $100 deposit

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

01:55 PM Cases 22CF23 and 21TR943 called together.  Defendant, Tina Marie Liptow, appeared with Attorney Alysja Otten making a special appearance.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to TR and misdmeanor charges.  WTLPH.  Def to apply for Ct-appointed before leaving the building.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
